intro: Prangos longistylis, commonly known as the long-styled fennel, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-shaped flowers. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features slender, hollow stems and finely divided leaves that resemble those of fennel. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with elongated styles that give it its scientific name. Prangos longistylis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a mild, anise-like scent.
